block-definition.comment: takes a snapshot with the webcam and reports it as a new costume, or zero if the user cancels
block-definition.translations: pt:$camera a imagem actual do vídeo pl:$camera zdjęcie

block.l: const url = `ws://${ip}:${port}`; const socket = new WebSocket(url); var tmp = false; socket.onopen = () => tmp = socket; socket.onerror = () => tmp = socket; return () => tmp;

try { // Handle Snap! costume or image object if (image && image.contents) { image = image.contents; } if (!(image instanceof HTMLCanvasElement || image instanceof HTMLImageElement)) { return -1; // Unsupported image type } // Create a canvas element const canvas = document.createElement('canvas'); const ctx = canvas.getContext('2d'); // Set the canvas size to match the image size canvas.width = image.width; canvas.height = image.height; // Draw the image onto the canvas ctx.drawImage(image, 0, 0); // Convert to Base64 const base64WithPrefix = canvas.toDataURL('image/jpeg'); // Remove the prefix "data:image/jpeg;base64," const base64 = base64WithPrefix.replace(/^data:image\/jpeg;base64,/, ''); return base64; } catch (err) { console.log('Base64 error: ', err); return -1; }

block-definition.s: send msg: %'msg' to socket: %'socket' with response

block.l: var tmp = false; socket.onmessage = (event) => tmp = event.data; socket.onerror = () => tmp = []; return () => tmp;

block-definition.s: send msg: %'msg' to socket: %'socket' without response
send base64_img: %'img' to socket: %'socket' to model: %'model_id' with response

custom-block.s: send msg: %txt to socket: %obj with response

block.l: var img = new Image(), cst = false; img.onload = () => cst = new Costume(img); img.src = frame; return () => cst;

block-definition.comment: Catch errors. Runs the first script. If it succeeds, nothing else happens. But if it has an error (something that would otherwise result in a red halo around the block), then the second script is run, with the text of the error message that would have been shown in the variable ERROR.
block-definition.translations: pt:tenta executar _ e, em caso de erro _ , executa _ ca:prova de forma segura _ i si _ _

block-definition.comment: Throw an error. Makes a red halo appear around the script that runs it, with the input text shown in a speech balloon next to the script, just like any Snap! error. This is useful to put in the second script of SAFELY TRY after some other instructions to undo the partial work of the first script.

block-definition.s: safely try reporting %'this' then if %'error' report %'that'
block-definition.comment: Catch errors in a reporter. Evaluates its first input. If that expression successfully reports a value, this block reports that value. If the expression causes a Snap! error, then the final input slot is evaluated with the text of what would have been the error message in variable ERROR. SAFELY TRY then reports the value of that final expression. Sometimes you'll want to throw an error in the final expression. You can put an ERROR block inside a CALL block to do that.
block-definition.translations: ca:prova de forma segura reportant _ i si _ reportant _

custom-block.s: send msg: %txt to socket: %obj with response
send msg: %txt to socket: %obj with response
